results.title: What little girls are made of (TEFC)
results.brief_description: For over a century male scientists have been searching for evidence to demonstrate female inferiority. This program explores this idea and the effect it has had on the relationship between women and science.

results.title: The War of words Down Under (TEFC)
results.brief_description: This program looks at the work of BUGAUP and other antismoking campaigns. It discusses the responsibility of the media, tobacco companies and government to public health.

results.title: Stop the drop: a concert for nuclear disarmament
results.brief_description: Footage from a benefit rock concert for the anti-uranium movement is shown and is combined with interviews with the performers of the concert. The concert was held at the Sidney Myer Music Bowl in Melbourne and the performers included bands such as “Goanna”, “Midnight Oil” “INXS”, “Men at work” and “Redgum”.

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Nomad Films International and Douglas Stanley
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.

results.title: The Cubbies
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Ron Saunders and David Woodgate
results.brief_description: Features an adventure playground which allows children to play on their own terms, and enables creative expression. Through the eyes of Joan Healy, Supervisor of the Fitzroy Adventure Playground (South Australia), the film takes a candid look at the children and their projects.

results.title: Learning English : it's harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Panorama Productions and New South Wales. Premier's Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division
results.brief_description: An Australian looks at the problems faced by migrants in learning to speak English. Through his investigation we learn that they face many problems: pressures of finding work as soon as they arrive, difficulties in finding classes that don’t conflict with work hours, working in jobs where there is little communication with others. Isolation restricts their practice of language
results.title_for_label: Learning English : it’s harder than you think (TEFC)
results.creator_credit_for_label: Panorama Productions and New South Wales. Premier’s Dept. Ethnic Affairs Division

results.title: Good buy
results.creator_credit: South Australian Film Corporation, Yoram Gross, Yoram Gross Films and Jill Robb
results.brief_description: This animated consumer education film reveals both bad buying habits of customers and the ploys of modern marketing. It is pointed out that in buying situations the facts presented may not be quite as true as they seem, and that careful deliberation is always a good policy including the necessity of obtaining a guarantee and the reading of fine print in any signed agreement.
results.creator_credit_for_label: South Australian Film Corporation, Yoram Gross, Yoram Gross Films and Jill Robb
